Name: Posting of special needs signs.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the posting of special needs signs.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

Section 1. Section FC 505 of chapter 2 of title 29 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subsection FC 505.3, to read as follows:
§505.3 Special needs signs. a. The term “special needs occupant” as used in this section means an occupant of a dwelling unit in a multiple dwelling that is under seven years of age, over sixty years of age, mobility impaired, possesses a pet, or such other classes of persons as are deemed appropriate by rule by the commisioner.
b. The owner of a multiple dwelling shall offer to the lawful occupants of each dwelling unit and, upon request, provide, install, and maintain, a special needs sticker of a design approved by the department that identifies the special needs occupants residing in a dwelling unit. Such special needs sticker shall be placed in the lower quadrant of dwelling unit entrance doors. The owner of a multiple dwelling shall remove such special needs sticker at the request of the occupants of the dwelling unit.
c. Any owner of a multiple dwelling who fails to comply with the provisions of this section shall be liable for a civil penalty of fifty dollars for each dwelling unit for which there was a failure to comply.
	§ 2. This local law shall take effect ninety days after enactment.
